channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Anthropic shakes up C-suite to expand its internal incubator
item.description: Mike Krieger, the Instagram co-founder who joined Anthropic two years ago as its chief product officer, is moving to a new focus at the AI startup: co-leading its internal incubator, dubbed the "Labs" team. The Anthropic Labs team started in mid-2024 with just two members; now, the company has decided to expand it, with a […]

item.title: The best noise-canceling headphones to buy right now
item.description: Whether you’re wearing them for the morning commute, while traveling, or if you’re simply trying to find some peace and quiet while working at home, noise-canceling headphones are a more essential piece of kit nowadays than ever before. And you’ve got a slew of great options to pick from; it’s hard to make a bad […]

item.title: Gigabyte debuts a consumer motherboard which supports 256GB DDR5 in dual channel — but you may need to sell a kidney to buy the memory
item.description: Gigabyte’s Z890 AORUS Tachyon ICE CQDIMM motherboard supports 256GB DDR5-7200 using two 128GB modules, achieving extreme capacity and frequency.

item.title: Apple's 13-inch MacBook Air M4 was crowned our best AI laptop of the year — and it's $200 off at Amazon
item.description: Apple's MacBook Air M4 was named TechRadar's best AI laptop of the year, and Amazon is offering a $200 discount, bringing the price down to $799.99.

item.title: Microsoft announces glut of new data centers but says it won’t let your electricity bill go up
item.description: The tech giant has pledged to be a "good neighbor" as it continues to invest in AI infrastructure throughout the country.

item.title: Data Center Project Cancellations Quadrupled in 2025 as Locals Fight Back
item.description: A win for advocacy!

item.title: RFK Jr.’s new food pyramid could be a disaster for the environment — if Americans actually follow it
item.description: The Trump administration announced last week that it wants Americans to consume more protein, churning out a colorful illustration of an inverted food pyramid that prominently features a big, red steak, a wedge of cheese, and a carton of whole milk at the top and claiming it's "ending the war on protein." It may seem […]

item.title: No, You Fools, There Is No ‘Lord of the Rings’ Extended Extended Edition
item.description: Peter Jackson has debunked the idea that there are extra-extra-long versions of his Oscar-winning Tolkien adaptations.

item.title: ‘Star Trek Real’: Hegseth Praises Grok for Allowing Users to Fight Wars
item.description: "We will win this race by becoming an AI-first war-fighting force across all domains," the Defense Secretary said Monday.

item.title: 3 new Prime Video movies to stream in January 2026 — including an iconic 80s comedy
item.description: The Breakfast Club leads my recommendations of the best new movies to stream on Prime Video in January 2026.

item.title: Mars aurait abrité un océan géant : une nouvelle étude apporte des indices difficile à contester
item.description: Par le passé, la Planète rouge était bleue, mais à quel point ? Les scientifiques s'interrogent toujours sur la quantité d'eau disponible à la surface de Mars il y a quelques milliards d'années, et certains pensent avoir trouvé un début de réponse dans les marques qui restent à la surface.

item.title: This new, dead simple prompt technique boosts accuracy on LLMs by up to 76% on non-reasoning tasks
item.description: In the chaotic world of Large Language Model (LLM) optimization, engineers have spent the last few years developing increasingly esoteric rituals to get better answers. We’ve seen "Chain of Thought" (asking the model to think step-by-step and often, show those "reasoning traces" to the user), "Emotional Blackmail" (telling the model its career depends on the answer, or that it is being accused of sexual misconduct), and complex multi-shot prompting frameworks.But a new paper released by Google Research suggests that we may have been overthinking it. The researchers found that simply repeating ...

item.title: Google Pixel 10a : prix, date de sortie et première image officielle en fuite
item.description: On sait désormais presque tout du Pixel 10a. Une fuite massive vient de nous livrer le prix, la date de sortie et même le premier rendu presse officiel. Si la baisse de tarif annoncée fait plaisir, le design, lui, risque de piquer un peu les yeux pour un smartphone de 2026.

item.title: A consumer watchdog issued a warning about Google’s AI agent shopping protocol — Google says she’s wrong
item.description: A consumer economics watchdog says Google's new Universal Commerce Protocol is ripe for misuse where consumers could pay more for items. Google denies this.

item.title: Proposed legislation opens the door to robotaxi services in New York
item.description: Waymo, Alphabet's self-driving car company, tested its autonomous vehicles in New York City in 2025, and as part of proposed legislation from New York Governor Kathy Hochul, the company could soon offer its services across the state, Wired reports.Governor Hochul's proposed legislation was formally announced during a State of the State address covering policy proposals for the upcoming year. The new law, if passed, would loosen the state's restrictions on self-driving car companies by forming a pilot program that would allow for "the limited deployment of commercial for-hire autonomous passeng...

item.title: 70 milliards de dollars plus tard, Meta acte le décès du métavers
item.description: Meta vient d'annoncer la suppression de 10 % des effectifs de sa division réalité virtuelle. Le géant américain abandonne ses ambitions de monde persistant pour se concentrer sur des produits qui se vendent enfin : les lunettes connectées.

item.title: No, it's not your new thermostat — mini PC vendor delivers clean-looking, minimalist, affordable device unlike any other on the market with a Core i9 CPU inside
item.description: Ayaneo AM03 mini PC combines minimalist design with Intel Core i9 performance, high-speed memory, and flexible connectivity options.

item.title: Microsoft shutters fan favorite deployment platform, to the dismay of many
item.description: Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) has been retired with immediate effect, but we knew this was coming a long time ago.

item.title: Your Slack Is Infected With an AI Agent Now
item.description: @Slackbot disable yourself.

item.title: Ammobia says it has reinvented a century-old technology
item.description: The startup has a new take on the Haber-Bosch process used to make ammonia. If Ammobia can deliver, it could change industries, from power generation to maritime shipping.

item.title: The 'most convenient vacuum we've ever tested' from Shark just dropped to an incredible price at Best Buy — and it's the best vacuum cleaner deal since Black Friday
item.description: Highly reviewed vacuum cleaner for under half price in Best Buy's latest sale

item.title: Taïwan émet un mandat d’arrêt contre Pete Lau, le co-fondateur et CEO de OnePlus
item.description: Pete Lau, le visage emblématique de OnePlus, fait désormais l'objet d'un mandat d'arrêt émis par la justice taïwanaise. En cause ? Une affaire de recrutement illégal de plus de 70 ingénieurs.

item.title: Ring founder details the camera company’s ‘intelligent assistant’ era
item.description: AI is ushering in Ring’s next chapter, as the Amazon-owned video doorbell maker shifts toward becoming an “intelligent assistant.”

item.title: Man to plead guilty to hacking US Supreme Court filing system
item.description: A 24-year-old from Tennessee is expected to admit to accessing the Supreme Court’s electronic filing system without authorization dozens of times throughout 2023.

item.title: Scientists Watched Viruses Attack Bacteria in Space. Things Got Weird
item.description: "Microbes continue to evolve under microgravity, and they do so in ways that are not always predictable."

item.title: Everything Is Content for the ‘Clicktatorship’
item.description: In the second Trump administration, online conspiracy theories are shaping real-world policies like never before.

item.title: Roblox’s AI-Powered Age Verification Is a Complete Mess
item.description: Kids are being identified as adults—and vice versa—on Roblox, while age-verified accounts are already being sold online.

item.title: Taiwan issues arrest warrant for Pete Lau, CEO of OnePlus
item.description: Taiwanese officials have issued an arrest warrant for OnePlus CEO Pete Lau on allegations of illegally employing workers in Taiwan. Two Taiwanese citizens who worked for Lau have also been indicted. The China-based smartphone company has been accused of illegally recruiting more than 70 engineers from Taiwan. Members of the Shilin District Prosecutors Office claim that OnePlus reportedly set up a shell company in Hong Kong with a distinct name, then launched a branch in Taiwan in 2015 without government approval. The branch reportedly worked on research and development for OnePlus mobile phone...

item.title: Meta is closing down three VR studios as part of its metaverse cuts
item.description: Meta is laying off about 10 percent of its Reality Labs metaverse division, and the cuts include closing down some of its VR gaming studios. Twisted Pixel Games, the developer of Marvel's Deadpool VR, Sanzaru Games, the developer of the Asgard's Wrath franchise, and Armature Studio, which worked on the Resident Evil 4 VR port, […]

item.title: Doctors think AI has a place in healthcare – but maybe not as a chatbot
item.description: OpenAI and Anthropic have each launched healthcare-focused products over the last week.

item.title: Lego Smart Brick: watch an immersive 15-minute demo like you’re right there with us at CES
item.description: The Lego Smart Brick won our Best in Show award at CES 2026, and it was no wonder after watching Lego designer Maarten Simons' expert demo there. So I thought: why not let you virtually attend the same tech demo I did? Before I left Las Vegas, I snuck back into Lego's suite to film […]

item.title: ‘Marvel Rivals’ Is Making Deadpool Take on All 3 Roles
item.description: In Deadpool's own style, the merc with a mouth himself announced that he will slot into all three of the Marvel hero shooter's role archetypes.

item.title: PC sales set for a 2026 downturn as memory demand hits other devices
item.description: Industry analysts agree: PC prices are rising. Upgrade your PC now or you'll either be faced with a higher bill or poorer specs in the future.

item.title: Shortcut Your System With a Discounted Elgato Stream Deck+
item.description: Elgato's Stream Deck+ adds knobs and an LCD for even more info at a glance.

item.title: Apple Hits Adobe Where It Hurts With an Affordable Creative App Suite
item.description: Apple’s Creator Studio takes in all its mainstay apps for a subscription price seven times cheaper than Creative Cloud.
